page.title: 04Bird Life of Silverdale
page.content: All the saltmarsh and intertidal area are a part of the R.S.P.B. Morecambe Bay Reserve. A new area, Allen Pool, has recently been formed by the R.S.P.B. to encourage waders to stay and breed. This and the flooded marshland attract many teal, shoveler, lapwing, redshank, and greylags. The changing channels are encouraging more birds to roost, the old breakwater and rocky outcrop at Jenny Brown's Point attracting turnstones.The wildfowl are now protected as the R.S.P.B. hold the shooting rights. Spring brings waders, Marsh Harrier, and Osprey.In winter there are many migrants, for which this is one of the most important areas in Britain. There are a great variety of butterflies and flora, some quite rare.The railway to the East acts as a barrier to flooding of the landward farmland.
